activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus D Mason

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:12 PM Defendant Marcus D Mason in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Marcus D Mason.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Richards has received copy of complaint and will waive reading and is ready to set for preliminary hearing. Court sets 11/09/22 at 1pm for a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant qualifies for a public defender but will not have one appointed to him before 10/31.

3:24 PM Defendant Marcus D Mason appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. MM states that he does qualify for a public defender. Court reset to allow the public defender to appear. Court tell MM what the charges are. 

Court speaks about bond. MM states that he can post $300. Court speaks about the current bond.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:01 PM Defendant Marcus D Mason appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. MM has received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court reads the complaint. Court asks about counsel. MM doesn't have an attorney and hasn't called the public defenders office. Court asks dispatch to help assist MM with calling the public defenders office. Court speaks about bond and suggest that MM get an attorney.  Court reset this case to allow MM time to call the public defender. Court will be wanting an update on counsel at the next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

12:58 PM Defendant Marcus D Mason appeared by video, in custody without counsel. Attorney Harper appears in the courtroom for the State of Wisconsin. 

MM hasn't had a chance to call the public defenders office.

State speaks about a pick up order with the surrounding states and asks for a $7,500 cash bond.

MM doesn't know if he can post $7,500.

Court orders $7,500 cash bond.

Initial set for 10/24/22 at 3 PM
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
